newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatia launches credit lines for entrepreneurs.
newsitem.headline: Croatia launches credit lines for entrepreneurs.

text.p: Croatia's Economy Ministry and Zagrebacka Banka on Monday launched new credit lines at nine percent annual interest to prop up the emerging private sector.
Some 100 million German marks will be made available to small and medium-term production enterprises this year through various commercial banks, minister Davor Stern told Reuters.
These borrowings will be guaranteed by a government agency.
"The biggest novelty is that we have introduced new programmes for the first-time entrepreneurs, so that those who are about to start their own business can obtain loans," Stern said.
The move was also aimed at reducing the pressure on the social network due to rising unemployment, caused by company restructuring, he said.
The lending rate was described "very favourable", compared to 13-20 percent in interest and other loan costs charged by Croatian banks.
